definition: supporter (person)
to hold/to embrace/to wrap around/to gather around (sb)/to throng/to swarm/to support/Taiwan pr. [yong3]
to protect

(after a verb or adjective) one who (is) .../(after a noun) person involved in .../-er/-ist/(used after a number or 後|后[hou4] or 前[qian2] to refer to sth mentioned previously)/(used after a term, to mark a pause before defining the term)/(old) (used at the end of a command)/(old) this

sentences.english: One of its foremost proponents is the country's most bankable director, Feng Xiaogang.
sentences.chinese: 其中最著名的擁護者是在中國最賣座的導演馮小剛。

sentences.english: May scientists who supported the prodution of atomic bombs are advocates of peace.
sentences.chinese: 許多支持生產原子彈的科學家是和平的擁護者。

sentences.english: Ustinov later became a staunch6 advocate for UNESCO.
sentences.chinese: 烏斯季諾夫後來成爲聯合國教科文組織的堅定擁護者。

sentences.english: Loyalist forces using tanks and rockets outgunned the rebel groups.
sentences.chinese: 扎卡菲擁護者使用坦克和火箭重火力壓倒了反對者。

sentences.english: Each of the several chief theories has its host of zealous partisans .
sentences.chinese: 那幾種主要見解，每種都有許多熱烈的擁護者。

sentences.english: Some advocates of the tax, however, eye broader benefits.
sentences.chinese: 然而，物業稅的擁護者着眼於更寬的利益。

sentences.english: Federalists are convinced this will speed up European integration.
sentences.chinese: 聯邦制擁護者相信這將加快歐洲一體化進程。

sentences.english: You are a vocal proponent for a cause.
sentences.chinese: 你成爲了某一目標的口頭擁護者。

sentences.english: As a methodist he was a fervent advocate of temperance .
sentences.chinese: 身爲一名衛理公會教徒，他是禁慾的熱情擁護者。

sentences.english: Halsey was identified as a leading proponent of the values of progressive education.
sentences.chinese: 哈爾西被認爲是進步教育價值觀的主要擁護者。

sentences.english: He is a stout supporter of the team.
sentences.chinese: 他是球隊的堅決擁護者。

sentences.english: Also rugby and handball have their adherents.
sentences.chinese: 橄欖球和手球同樣也有他們的擁護者。

sentences.english: The Republican charges that Obama has embraced a “declinist vision.”
sentences.chinese: 這位共和黨人指責奧巴馬是“衰落主義”的擁護者。

sentences.english: He is a keen advocate of park-and-ride schemes.
sentences.chinese: 他是“停車再換乘”計劃的熱情擁護者。

sentences.english: Advocates find their calling on the mediational side of diplomatic intelligence.
sentences.chinese: 擁護者在策略智慧的調停方面，找到了他們的定位。

sentences.english: I am pro-police — always have been and always will be.
sentences.chinese: 我是一個警察的擁護者，現在是，將來也是。

definition: to run neck and neck/to keep pace with/to keep abreast of/on a par with one another
(old) itinerant political adviser/(fig.) lobbyist/go-between/mouthpiece/also pr. [shuo1 ke4]
peer competition/to function as rivals/to make claims as an equal
to oppose each other with equal harshness (idiom); tit for tat/measure for measure
two-China (policy)
to be equal to/to be well-matched/rival
out of the ordinary
Milton (name)/John Milton (1608-1674), English republican writer and poet, author of Paradise Lost
to understand profoundly/well-versed/skillful/practiced/to have the knack
unheard of/an extremely rare and unprecedented event
separatism
to be full of admiration
to run a newspaper/to publish a newspaper
to be nothing to write home about (idiom)
lit. two armies have equivalent banners and drums (idiom); fig. evenly matched/roughly comparable (opponents)
to rope in/fig. to involve sb/to entice
